medical_history.chief_complaint: Child 1 presented with a large cyst in the left hepatic lobe measuring 19 cm.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The cyst was identified at 26 months of age, measuring 19 cm at presentation. Following surgical resection, multiple recurrent and enlarging cysts developed within 4 months, leading to a hepatic lobectomy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: After the initial surgery, Child 1 developed five benign thyroid nodules, while Child 2 had initial imaging at 9 months revealing a solid liver tumor which regressed over time.
medical_history.family_history: Family history was unremarkable for Child 1. Child 2's mother had pulmonary cysts removed and thyroid surgeries as a teenager.
